title: Armed Forces of Paraguay
text:
The Armed forces of <a href="Paraguay">Paraguay</a> () consist of the <a href="Paraguayan%20Army">Paraguayan army</a>, <a href="Navy%20of%20Paraguay">navy</a> (including <a href="naval%20aviation">naval aviation</a> and <a href="marine%20corps">marine corps</a>) and <a href="air%20force">air force</a>.
The <a href="constitution%20of%20Paraguay">constitution of Paraguay</a> establishes the <a href="president%20of%20Paraguay">president of Paraguay</a> as the <a href="commander-in-chief">commander-in-chief</a>.
Paraguay has <a href="Conscription">compulsory military service</a>, and all 18-year-old males and 17-year-olds in the year of their 18th birthday are liable for one year of <a href="active%20duty">active duty</a>. Although the 1992 constitution allows for conscientious objection, no enabling legislation has yet been approved.
In July 2005, military aid in the form of U.S. <a href="Special%20Forces">Special Forces</a> began arriving at Paraguay's <a href="Mariscal%20Estigarribia">Mariscal Estigarribia</a> air base, a sprawling complex built in 1982.
Army.
In land forces the Paraguayan Army is composed of a Presidential Guards Regiment, composed two battalions (<a href="infantry">infantry</a> and military police), an armored squadron, and a battery of field <a href="artillery">artillery</a>, plus the operationally attached Mounted Ceremonial Squadron "Aca Caraya" (which serves independently but as the mounted escort in state events, and serves as part of the 4th Cavalry Regiment). Their equipment includes three Argentinean modified M-4 tanks, four EE-9 armored cars, four EE-11 armored personnel carriers (APCs), three M-9 half-tracks mounting 20mm guns, and four M-101 105 mm <a href="howitzer">howitzer</a>s. Arguably, this "flagship" of military rule is structurally and physically the strongest of the EP. The REP is an independent unit from other commands. The EP features two artillery groups (GAC 1–12 88 mm QF-25 and GAC 2–12 105mm M-101) and one <a href="antiaircraft">antiaircraft</a> artillery group (GAA 13 40 mm L 40/60, <a href="Oerlikon%2020%26amp%3Bnbsp%3Bmm%20cannon">Oerlikon 20 mm cannon</a>s, and six M-55 4x12, 7.0 mm).
Six battalions of <a href="combat%20engineer">combat engineer</a>s, one communications battalion, one Special Forces battalion, seven regiments of infantry, six regiments of cavalry (R.C.-2 equipped with 12 M3A1, five operational, 20 M9 half-tracks modernized and R.C.-3: 24 EE-9 Cascavels, eight EE-11 Urutu APCs plus utility trucks for motorized infantry). This has little organic aviation available to it.
Each corps has a weapons school run by its command. The logistical command manages 10 addresses materials, mobilization, health care, etc. The command of the Army Institute of Education administers three schools, commissioned and noncommissioned officers, a military academy, and the CIMEFOR (a center for pre-military study that trains Reserve officers).
Each of the nine divisions that make up the three corps has one or two regiments of infantry or cavalry, its platoon of engineers, its communications section, military police units, etc.
Navy.
Although Paraguay is a landlocked country, it has a strong naval tradition by virtue of the fact that it has access to the <a href="Atlantic%20Ocean">Atlantic Ocean</a> through the <a href="Paraguay%20River">Paraguay</a>–<a href="Paran%C3%A1%20River">Paraná</a> rivers. The Paraguayan Navy has twelve bases. The main base is the Puerto Sajonia in <a href="Asuncion">Asuncion</a>, followed by Bahia Negra, Ciudad del Este, Encarnacion, Salto del Guaira. It also has facilities in Puerto Sajonia for helicopters and airplanes in SGAS. Naval personnel including Marine Corps aviation personnel, and the naval inward waters prefecture equal about 8,950. The Marine Corps have 800 marines, of which 400 are assigned to one commando unit with the rest being organized into a single battalion consisting of three <a href="Company%20%28military%20unit%29">companies</a>.
In terms of vessels, the Navy has 34 surface ships, some of which have reached centenarian age. (This is due in part to limited use and floating in fresh water.) The main vessels and the flagship of the Paraguay Navy is still <a href="Humait%C3%A1-class%20gunboat">"Humaita"</a>, which was <a href="Ship%20commissioning">commissioned</a> prior to Paraguay's involvement in the <a href="Chaco%20War">Chaco War</a>. It has a further four <a href="patrol%20vessel">patrol vessel</a>s, of which the oldest was commissioned in 1908 and the newest in 1985. The Navy has 17 patrol boats of various drafts, four of which were donated by <a href="Taiwan">Taiwan</a> and the United States, while the other 13 were built locally. The rest of the fleet is composed of <a href="tugboat">tugboat</a>s, <a href="barge">barge</a>s, <a href="landing%20craft">landing craft</a>, transports, and a <a href="presidential%20yacht">presidential yacht</a>. The new additions are four Croc-class riverine vessels from Australia, plus 43 locally built riverline patrol vessels constructed from 2006–2009. For air support, one <a href="Helibras%20HB350">Helibras HB350</a> helicopter is used to provide <a href="Search%20and%20rescue">SAR</a>, <a href="MEDEVAC">MEDEVAC</a> and utility work

Air Force.
The air force, the newest and smallest of the services, has about 1,100 personnel as of 2012. The Paraguayan Air Forces is organised in an Air Brigade of seven air groups and a brigade of paratroopers on battalion level. Almost all operating units are based in premises at <a href="Silvio%20Pettirossi%20International%20Airport">Silvio Pettirossi International Airport</a> (SGAS) in Asunción.
The units comprising the force are: the (TAG) with three fighter squadrons (numbered 1 to 3), respectively equipped with the MB-326, T-33 and EMB-312. The first two are in storage or operating either by withdrawal of this aircraft. The squadron "Moros", equipped with Tucanos, has only one squadron (3 airplanes active). The Air Transport Group (GTA) operates aircraft of the CASA, DHC-6, and Beechcraft types. The Helicopter air group (HLG) has a SAR squadron, a utility squadron, and a squadron of attack craft, and is equipped with ex-Taiwanese UH-1H and Brazilian HB-350B aircraft. The Air Group Instruction (AFI) has materials and T-25 and T-35 aircraft. Photogrammetric called air group (GAF) and group aviation maintenance section (SEMAER) do not have aircraft assigned. The Parachute Brigade operates CASA aircraft. Paraguayan Helicopters constantly flew the skies of Asuncion during the visit of Pope Francis in July 2015
Besides these groups is a command of Institutes of Education and one of regions air, this latter has nominal jurisdiction over 12 tracks and airports as six of these are considered Air Bases.
